lead_paragraph: NEWS Seen Anew ''Yes Yoko Ono'' is the title of the exhibition that opens today at the Japan House Gallery, at 333 East 47th Street, Manhattan. Billed as the first American retrospective devoted to Ms. Ono's avant-garde art, the show spans 40 years and features about 150 works. ''Yes'' examines her role in the avant-garde movement Fluxus; her contributions to Conceptual Art in New York, London and Tokyo; her concerts, experimental films, vocal recordings and public art, including works with John Lennon; and her more recent interactive installations and site-specific art. Also represented is her collaborative work with avant-garde figures like John Cage, George Maciunas, Nam June Paik, Charlotte Moorman, Andy Warhol and Ornette Coleman. The show runs through Jan. 14 before a tour destined for Minneapolis; Houston; Cambridge, Mass.; and San Francisco, among other places.
